justification: The research describes using a warm or cold cup manipulation to study the effects of temperature on social thought processes and recollection of close others, thus measuring social thermoregulation.
The Experiences in Close Relationships questionnaire (ECR) was used to measure participants' self-reported experiences with past relationships as a potential moderator of the temperature effects.

measured_by: STRAQ-1 (Social Thermoregulation and Risk Avoidance Questionnaire)
justification: The STRAQ-1 was introduced to assess the desire to outsource temperature regulation and avoid social risks, providing a new tool for measuring social thermoregulation-based attachment desires.

measured_by: Inclusion of Other in Self (IOS) Scale
justification: The IOS scale was used to measure how close participants felt to the people they wrote down after the temperature manipulation, reflecting the cognitive accessibility of loved ones.
A new subscale named Relationship Closeness Regulation was derived from the ECR through data-driven exploration to better moderate the temperature-social thought relationship.
